Text: Woooshrrraaahhh!!!
Hmm...!
To think you've grown this much in just half a year...!

Servant of Shadow... The hidden potential of the
Seven Shadows... You are not to be underestimated.
You are nearly a match for that man when it comes
to sheer strength!
Whoa! Am I getting stronger?

Indeed... I am genuinely looking forward to
witnessing your future growth...!

Grrrr... One day, I'll beat you up just like Boss
man did!

...But first, I've gotta defeat the dragon prey
Lady Alpha told me about!
...Oh? Dragon hunting, are you?
So, you've come to me for wisdom...?
That's right!

Umm... It's about Malak! You're a dragon as well.
Have you heard of this guy?
Malak... Malak the Malevolent, huh...

To speak of him, you must first understand the
dragons of this world...!
The dragons of this world...?
...Long ago, ancient dragons existed in this world.

Emerging from the seas, they adapted to the
terrestrial environment, dominating the skies
and the earth with impunity.

However, the glory of these ancient dragons lasted
only until magic from another world flowed into
ours.

Unable to adapt to this magic, the numbers of the
dragons rapidly dwindled, leading to their decline...

...And those who adapted to the magic prospered on
the earth where the ancient dragons once thrived...
Beings in human form—humans,
elves, and...
...therianthropes.

They were species who adapted to the newly defined
natural environment transformed by magic.

All humans, elves, and therianthropes living in this
world today can be said to have inherited this
primal bloodline...
...I've got no idea what you're talking about.
Wait, has the story even started yet?
Heh...

While the ancient dragons as a race were perishing,
there existed a few who adapted to the magic.
Their bloodline is what we now call dragons...

Adapting to this new environment...a mutation
perhaps, turned dragons into beings incapable
of death.

Their never-ending lives allowed dragons to reclaim
their status as rulers of the world, but...

On the other hand, the absence of natural predators
and their eternal lives brought on a stagnation that
slowly eroded their souls and spirits.

Eventually, dragons vanished from the forefront of
history, aimlessly living their days in decadence.
...This is truly a curse brought on by the world.

The reason a wise dragon like myself values the
evolution of the humanoid races...

It's because I hope that at the end of their
evolution, they will unravel the secrets of the
dragon's mutation, and I will receive the gift of
death...!

Aah, enough! I don't need this confusing talk!
Just tell me about Malak already!
...You therianthropes are so impatient.

I don't know when or where the species of Malak
originated, but...

Likely, as a result of de-evolution, it is a dragon
that has lost its ability to fly.

Moreover, over the course of time, it failed to acquire
a means of communication with other species, such as
language...

Indeed, it is a pitiable existence for a creature
that, while descending from the ancient dragons,
found itself at an evolutionary dead-end, unable to
adapt or evolve further.

...I've got no idea what all that's supposed to
mean.

But I sort of get that you're talking about the laws
of nature.

Hmm... For the time being, that's a good way to feel
about it.

That feeling itself is proof that you are you...
a therianthrope...who is still evolving.

...To kill a dragon, you must seek the origin of its
species. Everything starts from there...!
Origin...uh...species...
Do you have one of those?
...Perhaps I did once, but now it's lost in oblivion.

That's what it means to live forever. To live long
enough to even forget one's own origins...
